bug.author: Praveenk8051
bug.summary: RuntimeError: failed to convert from TensorFlow to IR.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
The conversion from protobuf graph to coreml is failing. The model is trained by transfer learning of mobilenet architecture It is occuring during convertion from .pb graph to coreml issue <denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
WARNING:tensorflow:From /Users/praveen/opt/anaconda3/envs/untitled/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow_core/python/compat/v2_compat.py:65: disable_resource_variables (from tensorflow.python.ops.variable_scope) is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Instructions for updating: non-resource variables are not supported in the long term WARNING:root:TensorFlow version 2.0.0 detected. Last version known to be fully compatible is 1.14.0 . Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/praveen/opt/anaconda3/envs/untitled/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/tensorflow/_tf_converter.py", line 69, in convert ssa = frontend_load(filename, resume_on_errors=False, inputs=inputs, outputs=outputs, **kwargs) File "/Users/praveen/opt/anaconda3/envs/untitled/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/nnssa/frontend/tensorflow/load.py", line 50, in load raise ValueError('Shape of required input {} is not provided.'.format(name)) ValueError: Shape of required input input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder is not provided. During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/tf_to_coreml.py", line 14, in class_labels=r'/test_/test.txt', File "//tfcoreml/_tf_coreml_converter.py", line 692, in convert custom_shape_functions=custom_shape_functions) File "/tensorflow/_tf_converter.py", line 73, in convert raise RuntimeError('failed to convert from TensorFlow to IR. {}'.format(e)) RuntimeError: failed to convert from TensorFlow to IR. Shape of required input input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder is not provided. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
I can send the .pb file and label file if you can email to <denchmark-link:mailto:praveenk8051@gmail.com>praveenk8051@gmail.com</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version : 1.1.0 macOS version (if applicable):10.14.6 How you install python : anaconda interpreter, PyCharm IDE python version: 3.7.4 any other relevant information: Tensorflow 2.0.0 tfcoreml : 1.1.0

comments.comment:
When i see the shape of the input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder it is (?,1001). So i tried to put the conversion code like below. Since there is another placeholder(bottleneck) apart from input and output <denchmark-code>tfcoreml.convert( tf_model_path='/test_/model.pb', mlmodel_path='/test_/delete_test.mlmodel', input_name_shape_dict={"input": [1, 224, 224, 3], "input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder": [None, 1001]}, output_feature_names=["final_result"], image_input_names=["input"], red_bias=-1, green_bias=-1, blue_bias=-1, image_scale=2.0 / 255.0, minimum_ios_deployment_target='13', class_labels='/test_/labels.txt', )
</denchmark-code>
but unfortunately NoneType is not accepted
Can anyone help me with this?
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Praveenk8051>@Praveenk8051</denchmark-link> , can you share the model pb file you're using? Thanks!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Praveenk8051>@Praveenk8051</denchmark-link> Can you try passing in the shape of as and see if it helps?

@Praveenk8051 Can you try passing in the shape of "input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder" as [-1, 1001] and see if it helps?
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20404922/71090757-0d513380-21a4-11ea-8754-4776b77f3cc5.png></denchmark-link>

Hi @Praveenk8051, can you share the model pb file you're using? Thanks!
Did you get my email?

Hi @Praveenk8051, can you share the model pb file you're using? Thanks!
<denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Tw_TJMzNFWdfWtcnvuuUOa8rGSi353CV?usp=sharing>https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Tw_TJMzNFWdfWtcnvuuUOa8rGSi353CV?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
Every detail is provided on time. It would be helpful if this issue looked upon timely

Please try following two modifications:
Try removing the node input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder in the tensorflow graph. It appears to be a redundant operation.
Try calling the converter without class_labels option for now and see if the conversion works after modification 1 is done.

Please try following two modifications:
Try removing the node input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder in the tensorflow graph. It appears to be a redundant operation. Try calling the converter without class_labels option for now and see if the conversion works after modification 1 is done.
Deleting a node may not be a solution as per <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/2245>tensorflow/tensorflow#2245</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37610757/how-to-remove-nodes-from-tensorflow-graph>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37610757/how-to-remove-nodes-from-tensorflow-graph</denchmark-link>
Also, it really isn't straight forward to perform the node deletion. Another observation is that tf to coreml conversion works perfectly in Tf - 1.14.0 version but not in Tf 2.0.0 for the same problem

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Praveenk8051>@Praveenk8051</denchmark-link>
FYR, I was able to do <denchmark-code>tf_converter.convert(tf_model_path='/tmp/test.pb', mlmodel_path='test_test.mlmodel', image_input_names='input', output_feature_names=['final_result'], input_name_shape_dict={'input': [1, 224, 224, 3], "input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder": [-1, 1001]}, predicted_probabilities_output='final_result', predicted_feature_name='classLabel', class_labels='/tmp/test.txt', minimum_ios_deployment_target='13')
</denchmark-code>
after <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/coremltools/pull/509>#509</denchmark-link> . Where test.pb and test.txt are from your google drive.

@Praveenk8051 FYR, I was able to do tf_converter.convert(tf_model_path='/tmp/test.pb', mlmodel_path='test_test.mlmodel', image_input_names='input', output_feature_names=['final_result'], input_name_shape_dict={'input': [1, 224, 224, 3], "input_1/BottleneckInputPlaceholder": [-1, 1001]}, predicted_probabilities_output='final_result', predicted_feature_name='classLabel', class_labels='/tmp/test.txt', minimum_ios_deployment_target='13')
after #509. Where test.pb and test.txt are from your google drive. @freedomtan I haven't tried this from Dec last week. Maybe some bug has fixed it? Not sure. But, Please find the link below. [https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Tw_TJMzNFWdfWtcnvuuUOa8rGSi353CV]

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Praveenk8051>@Praveenk8051</denchmark-link> I mean with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/coremltools/pull/509>#509</denchmark-link> I can convert your model with your label file without problem.

This bug fix should be included in coremltools 3.2 release. Please upgrade your coremltools(pip install --upgrade coremltools) to verify. Feel free to re-open if you still encountering this issue. Thanks!

This bug fix should be included in coremltools 3.2 release. Please upgrade your coremltools(pip install --upgrade coremltools) to verify. Feel free to re-open if you still encountering this issue. Thanks!
Sounds great. Thank you :)
